data.title: Obituary for Peggy Lucille Graham

data.meta_site_name: Obituary for Peggy Lucille Graham | Thatcher's Funeral Home, Inc.
data.text:
Life’s Reflection

Peggy Lucille Graham, 73, passed away on September 22, 2022, at her home, in Kansas City, Kansas. She was born on October 22, 1948, in Corinth, Mississippi to William and Ida Mae (Fleming) Ratliff.

Peggy grew up in Corinth, Mississippi. She graduated from Corinth High School in Corinth, Mississippi in 1965. After high school she attended college at Kansas City Kansas Community College in Kansas City, Kansas where she received an Associate Degree in Paralegal. Peggy worked for Douglas State Bank as a Teller where she worked for 10 years. Peggy also worked for the State of Kansas Social Rehabilitation Services as a File Clerk, Human Resources Assistant, Legal Secretary, Case Worker, and Employment Preparation Specialist, where she worked and retired after 25 years.

Peggy married Henry B. Graham in 1965 in Kansas City, Missouri. They were happily married for 29 years.

Peggy was a faithful member of Second Baptist Church under the leadership of Pastor Roy A. Reed. She was involved in various ministries at Second Baptist Church, Evangelistic Ministry, Matron Missionary, Sunday School Teacher, Secretary for the late (Pastor Roy A. Reed) and a faithful Deaconess.

She later joined Oak Ridge Missionary Baptist Church under the leadership of Senior Pastor, Dr. Ricky D. Turner. She was active in the Mission and coordinator for the Widows Ministry until her health failed. She enjoyed cooking, traveling, being a volunteer secretary, and spending time with her children and grandchildren.

Peggy was preceded in death by her spouse, Henry Buddy Graham; parents, William T. Ratliff Sr., and Ida Mae Ratliff; sisters, Daisy Gardner, Ethel Mann, Inez McManus, and Ernestine Brunson; brother, William “Bud” Ratliff Jr.

Peggy is survived by her children, LaVonda (Ron) Morton, Grandview, Missouri; Rodney (Rochelle) Graham, Raytown, Missouri; Michael (Catina) Graham, Raymore, Missouri; Kevin Graham (Anita Harding), Washington, D.C.; her brothers and sisters, Jesse (Barb) Ratliff; Champaign, Illinois; Joe Ed “Sonny” (Lola) Ratliff; Champaign, Illinois; Helen (Leonard) Brock, Tishomingo, Mississippi; her 18 grandchildren; 8 great-grandchildren; her nieces, nephews, and other relatives.
